meanings.definition: Set into the surface of something.
meanings.sent1: She carefully inlaid the gemstone into the necklace.
meanings.sent2: The artist inlaid the tiles into the mosaic table.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel inlaid acorns into the ground for safekeeping.
meanings.sent4: His words inlaid a sense of hope into her heart.
meanings.sent5: The stars inlaid the night sky with their twinkling beauty.

meanings.definition: Decorated with a design or material set into the surface.
meanings.sent1: The antique table had intricate inlaid patterns on its surface.
meanings.sent2: The jewelry box was adorned with inlaid mother-of-pearl.
meanings.sent3: The cake was inlaid with colorful frosting flowers.
meanings.sent4: Her eyes sparkled like inlaid diamonds in the sunlight.
meanings.sent5: The ancient chest was inlaid with stories of forgotten times.
